Cast

Denis Lavant

Anton

"When you concentrate not on a text but simply on a feeling, a gesture or an action, you can refine your acting performance in a certain way."

Denis Lavant completed his acting training at the National Conservatory for Drama in Paris and became one of France's best-known theater actors. His breakthrough on screen came with three productions by Leos Carax, with the last, "Les Amants du Pont Neuf," bringing him international recognition. For TUVALU, he was chosen as best actor at the "Faces of Love" festival in Moscow.

Filmography (selection): Boy Meets Girl (1983), Mauvais Sang (1986), Les Amants du Pont Neuf (1991), Beau Travail (1999)

Chulpan Hamatova

Eva

"The film TUVALU has a very special atmosphere. It becomes clear to you that it makes absolutely no difference where you live, whether in Russia, France or America. As long as we speak the same language — without words — we understand each other. That fascinates me about this film: the form of communication where language is no longer important."

Through leading roles in the films "Vremya Tantsora" and "Strana Gluhich" (The Land of Silence), Chulpan Hamatova drew attention to herself. Today, at 24, she is a star in her homeland. She played the lead role alongside Moritz Bleibtreu in the film "Papa Luna" by Bakhtyar Khudojnazarov. For the role of "Eva" in Veit Helmer's film "TUVALU," she was chosen as best actress at the "Faces of Love" film festival in Moscow.

Filmography: Strana Gluchich (1997), Vremya Tantsora (1998), Luna Papa (1999), Tuvalu (1999)

Philippe Clay

Karl (Anton's Father)

Philippe Clay, born in Paris, became famous in the 1950s as a chansonnier. He appeared in numerous French film productions, including Jean Renoir's "French Cancan" (1955). His distinctive portrayal of the blind father Karl in TUVALU shows his extraordinary acting range.

Filmography (selection): French Cancan (1955), Les Amants de Teruel (1962)

E.J. Callahan

Gregor (Anton's Brother)

E.J. Callahan is an American actor who has appeared in numerous film and television productions. In TUVALU, he plays the unscrupulous older brother Gregor, who wants to destroy the swimming pool.
